questions.question: What you said ……………………… unpardonable.
questions.description: Here the subject is the noun clause 'what you said'. When the subject is a clause, the verb is usually singular.

questions.question: They spoke in a low voice lest they ………………………. wake up the baby.
questions.description: Should is the only auxiliary that can be used after lest.

questions.question: If you had called her, she ……………………… happy.
questions.description: In the third conditional, use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Which of the following words does not have a plural form?
Smoking is injurious to health. Here smoking is a ………………….
questions.description: Ing forms used as the subject of a clause is a gerund.

questions.question: There is a cottage ……………………… the river.
questions.description: Above is preferred when one thing is not directly over another.

questions.question: Nobody came, ……………………?
questions.description: Affirmative tags are used after negative expressions like nobody. In question tags, use they to refer to nobody, somebody, anybody.

questions.question: Neither fish nor meat …………………….. with me.
questions.description: When you connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Call them at once. Change into passive.
questions.description: We use let to change imperatives into passive.
answers: Let them be called at once.
They should be called at once.

questions.question: My sister …………………….. abroad.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about permanent living arrangements.
